ygData.subject: Re: Baby
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine ran into the forrest to the spot where Ice had directed him, he didn t see anything but his sense of smell told him that another bot had gotten there

Lunarpine ran into the forrest to the spot where Ice had directed him, he
didn't see anything but his sense of smell told him that another bot had
gotten there first. The transmutant opened a comm back to Ice "To late,
whatever you sensed is gone now."

Ice tried to detect the emotions she'd fealt earlier but couldn't. "I'm not
senseing anything, thank you for trying though I'll give you a kiss for
checking."

Lunarpine smiled a toothy grin. "Thats reward enough for me." he turned and
charged back toward the CF still worried about what was happening there.

The wind shifted and brought a peculiar scent to the wolfs nose. "The
virus?" he thought knowing that there were only two bots that he knew with
that scent and this wasn't one of them. (Megaton)
----- Original Message -----
From: CYBERWOLF4 <cyberwolf4@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, February 27, 2001 7:51 AM
Subject: Re: Baby


Sorry to hear about your misfortune, hope nobody was hurt.

Lunarpine and Ice were trapped inside the shields of the CF, They knew that
the shield was weakening and they couldn't act. Ice had an idea though. her
ability to ability to weaken machinery could come in handy. She began to
concentrate when she picked up strong emotions of fear, confusion, and
loneliness coming from the forrest in the distance. "I'm getting something,"
she said trying to make sense of it. she'd held her telepathy in check for
the most part until now. She couldn't communicate at that distance so she'd
have to try something else. She went back to concentrating on the shields.
"I don't know if this will work. It'll either damage the shields worse or do
nothing at all."

Lunarpine contemplated the odds. "It'll be a long shot but at least we'll be
doing something."

Ice focused her strength on the shields in front of her. "When I say go we
move." her paws started to glow, she raised her left and pointed, then her
right. A jolt of power launched forward striking the shield. "GO" she yelled
to her partner.

Lunarpine dashed forward hitting the shield hard, he could tell it was weak
and a sudden push forced him through. Ice had used her telekinetics to give
him the push he needed. The wolfbot was free but Ice was still inside.

"Get going, head for the forrest and find it." Ice instructed rather sure of
herself, She didn't know what she fealt she was just sure it was alone and
frightened.
----- Original Message -----
From: Moon Mist <shadowwarrior_ax@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 6:11 PM
Subject: Baby



BB: Sorry I haven't been online. My cabin burnt and my computer went with
it.

3 days ago BrightBlade had died of a disease  in the forests surrounding the
Cybertronean Fire, her body left to rot with the surrounding leafs.
But even her death wasn't for nothing. She'd died after days and nights of
hard labor, trying to keep her little treasure alive.
Somehow, someway, her systems had created a child that had grown inside of
her until, at the weakest point, it was born.
A blind, tiny kit that could fit in the palm of a human hand, a baby girl
with a mother already diseased and ready to die.
And so she had, leaving the baby to suckle whatever milk was left in her
body before she stopped producing and it dried up.
But now the milk was gone, BrightBlade's body already beginning to rot, and
the little baby slightly weak from malnutrition.
Tiny as she was, still so young and blind, she'd managed to hang on this
long with a hungry tummy. Every sound causing her to whine and cry, little
yipps filling the forest whenever the wind picked up.  Too young to be
frightened, all she ever did was crawl around her mother's body, urged close
by her familiar scent even when hunger gnawed.
But today the rank smell of BrightBlade's body masked her scent and the
little kit was confused, bleating for her mother as she slowly crawled on
her tummy away from the body, trying to find the smell of Mom.
She moved out towards the forest and the clearing beyond.
Being only 3 days old, her muscles worked in tiny spasms and she couldn't
control them beyond crawling, but always she was yipping and crying out,
hoping for mother to hear her and come and get her. Remembering the furry
side where life giving milk came from.
But her mother never came and she was getting cold, her tummy making little
hungry sounds.
Even though her eyes weren't open yet she could hear, and she shots coming
from the clearing reminded her of the soft rumbles her mother made. So,
thinking of her mother, she cried louder as she tried to hurry her crawling,
little red coat spotted here and there with ash as she moved along the
forest floor. Moving towards the battle at the maximal base. Covering no
more then 1-ï¿½ feet in 2 min.
